description: Replace .env files with proper secret management solution. Choose per deployment (AWS Secrets Manager, HashiCorp Vault, Azure Key Vault, python-keyring). Migrate Anthropic/OpenAI/Google/XAI keys, update docs, add rotation policy, update connectors.

title: Implement Rate Limiting for AI API Calls
description: Add per-provider rate limiting (Anthropic 100/h, OpenAI 200/h, Google 150/h, Grok 100/h), exponential backoff, cost tracking & alerting, metrics hooks.
notes: Strategic Plan Phase 2.5 Week 1 HIGH priority. Effort 2-3h. Cost control.

title: Add pgvector Extension for Semantic Search
description: Enable semantic similarity search via PostgreSQL + pgvector. Create embedding tables (reports, knowledge, feedback), implement VectorSearchService, integrate sentence-transformers (all-MiniLM-L6-v2), migrate from SQLite to Postgres, document API.
notes: Strategic Plan Phase 2.5 Week 3. Depends on WS-TASK-005 completion. Effort 4-6h.

title: Implement Session File Encryption
description: Encrypt research session files at rest using cryptography (Fernet). Implement EncryptedSessionStore, manage keys via secret manager (WS-TASK-058), add rotation, update session_store pipeline and docs.
notes: Strategic Plan Phase 2.5 Week 1. Depends on WS-TASK-058. Effort 1-2h.

title: Consolidate databases - merge workspace.db, proposals.db, orchestration_decisions.db
description: Merge multiple SQLite databases (workspace.db, proposals.db, orchestration_decisions.db) into single database for local development. Managing 5+ SQLite files creates 'Database Hell' - becomes nightmare for joins/analytics. Consolidate into single SQLite for local development. Only split if deploying to microservices architecture. Related to DEC-006.
notes: From Gemini Architecture Review (2025-11-21). High priority action item. Risk: Database fragmentation and complexity. Current: 5+ SQLite files (workspace.db, meridian.db, proposals.db, orchestration_decisions.db, positions.db).

title: Implement real LLM-based intent analysis for The Bastard (un-mock)
description: Replace naive keyword matching in The Bastard with real LLM-based intent analysis. Current implementation uses string matching (e.g., 'kubernetes'), which will flag false positives (e.g., comments saying 'We are NOT using kubernetes'). Wire to cheap/fast LLM (gpt-4o-mini or gemini-flash) to analyze intent, not just string matching. Related to DEC-007.
